result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly R Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kelly R Thompson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kelly R Thompson was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court with Attorney Daniel Craig Musser.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #3      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 90 days in the DCJ, with Huber, cs to 22CF369

-Stayed for 3 years probation cc to 21CF741, 21CF1437, 21CF1669, 22CF229, 22CF369, 21CM428

CONDITIONS:
-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-Provide DNA sample on June 23rd at 2:00 pm

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #3
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation
 
-Days credit if revoked: Zero days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

[Jaime D.]

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. 
-The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services immediately following his/her release from jail. 
-Then the defendant is to report to Monarch Addiction Services for intake at 521 East Washington Ave, Madison WI 53703. 
-The defendant will then need to report to inpatient treatment at 2009 East Dayton Street Madison WI 53704. 
-The defendant will be making her own transportation arrangements for intake and inpatient treatment.
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _x_ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Daniel Craig Musser. Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In court today for a bail/bond hearing by request of the DE. Atty Musser advises his client has been accepted to a treatment facility, and requests a signature bond. No acceptance letter has been submitted to the court by Atty Musser for the treatment. State is in agreement with what the defense is proposing. Court makes findings and grants the request for a signature bond with a referral to pretrial services for GPS monitoring and random drug tests. DE is to report to pretrial services immediatley after release from the dane county jail. Then the DE is to report to Monarch Addiction Services for intake at 521 East Washington Ave, Madison WI 53703. The DE will then need to report to inpatient treatment at 2009 East Dayton Street Madison WI 53704. DE will be making her own transportation arrangements for intake and inpatient treatment. ALL OTHER BAIL CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME.
Bail/bond hearing on May 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

RE 4/29/2022 Motion for Bond Hearing. Argument by defense. Argument by State. Court modified bail.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

09:38 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Daniel Craig Musser.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moved for finding of transactional relation between Counts 1, 2, and 5-8. No objection by defense. Court made finding. State called first witness. Deputy Bridges duly sworn & testified. Cross by defense. State called second witness. Deputy Katzenmeyer duly sworn & testified. Direct by State. Cross by defense. State moved for bind over. Objection and argument by defense. Court granted motion for bind over.

05:20 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Defense moved to dismiss Complaint, made argument. Court denied motion.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
